website_summaries.verdict: The Mattel View-Master is best viewed as a low-priced "My First Virtual Viewer" for the whole family, if you're OK with a few restrictions.
pros: The Mattel View-Master is inexpensive and easy to get up and running, plus it looks pretty darn cool
It works with both Android and iPhones
cons: The Experience Reels aren't exactly coming thick and fast
It's not designed to work with headphones, which might prove frustrating

website_summaries.verdict: The Mattel View-Master Virtual Reality Viewer is an inexpensive and innovative way to take your kids on an immersive journey through space, famous landmarks, or the great outdoors, without leaving your home.
pros: VR Viewer is rugged, easy to hold, and can be used with Google Cardboard apps
cons: Comes with a single demo reel
Navigating through the Experience Pack apps can be difficult to master for young kids
Each Experience requires its own app

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY false advertising as the app you need to use the damn thing no longer exists and hasn’t since November 2019, my son was so excited on his birthday to try out the space experience (bought separately) also a complete waste of money, so no don’t buy
customer_reviews.author: Clare Scott

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Great tool for learning
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic piece of kit for kids a Virtual Reality viewmaster that actually brings the views to life! Great to experience elephants and animals just wandering past you, so close you could touch them. A great learning tool for kids to experience
customer_reviews.author: Claire McLean

customer_reviews.title: Grainy images
customer_reviews.text: The images are grainy and unsuitable for viewing my SBS 3D photos. I'm not sure why this is so, because the lenses appear to be clear. Fine for kids I think, if you're using the Viewmaster content.
customer_reviews.author: Beardy Pete

customer_reviews.title: Fun stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Having grown up with the original view master I thought I would give this a go having heard Tim Dashwood praise the system, and must say I am truly impressed. Works well with google apps, as well as youtube, in addition to the supplied Mattel disc. Using it with an iPhone 6s.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good value for money. 9 year old made up with it. Good quality. Be careful not to think the black adjuster for smaller phone is not packaging and throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Tee

customer_reviews.title: now that was great fun!
customer_reviews.text: There is far too much effort to try and get this thing to work. Give me the old fashion Viewmaster any day, now that was great fun!
customer_reviews.author: OZ

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted to go to Space and with this gem plus a Space Experience pack, I was able to do so 😊. It's slightly larger than the original view master but that's because you need to attach your phone, so there must be space for that. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: It's in Polish!
customer_reviews.text: The packaging is entirely in Polish! I don't speak Polish and nor do my children! How do we make this work?!
customer_reviews.author: ms.glug

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff but no point buying if you have a ...
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff but no point buying if you have a iPhone there just isn't a lot you can do on it. If you have a android then I do recommend
customer_reviews.author: mustapha

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with product. Disappointed that app has limited ability so need to purchase additional experience packs
customer_reviews.author: Charmaine

customer_reviews.title: I got the wrong impression, due this being called ...
customer_reviews.text: I got the wrong impression,due this being called Viewmaster as well as Virtual Reality,and the effect from the reel was less our expectations, Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: Use with the supplied disc doesn't work. A world of usable apps on play store made me pleased I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: mr s beadle

customer_reviews.title: I'm really impressed. My son loves it, but ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm really impressed. My son loves it, but he is too young to fully appreciate it. Ace for kids who can read upwards . Very informative . Phones get hot !!
customer_reviews.author: Mumofmadmax

customer_reviews.title: a poor buy! Brilliant idea poorly executed
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, a poor buy! Brilliant idea poorly executed! A cardboard VR does the same job!
customer_reviews.author: lvlark

customer_reviews.title: The viewer opens ridiculously easy and Your phone can just fall at any time
customer_reviews.text: The viewer opens ridiculously easy and Your phone can just fall at any time. Forget about big movements-You will trash Your phone.....Speaking by exp here.... :( And has no band for attachment to the head,so You get Your hands tires quite fast!
customer_reviews.author: Dobril

customer_reviews.title: but I was left very disappointed with Google Cardboard itself
customer_reviews.text: The product itself couldn't be faulted, but I was left very disappointed with Google Cardboard itself. I did not feel VR immersion at all and I hope that with Google Daydream, Google can have another crack at this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It'll take your brain to another dimension
customer_reviews.text: Like the old 1960's version only better this box of tricks is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Alastair

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have a very happy son using this now = I tried it and its very convincing
customer_reviews.author: Moira B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing gadget all the family enjoy using it thank you 😊
customer_reviews.author: skt

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Too much hassle once the novelty has worn off, only a few vr games that actually interest.
customer_reviews.author: scoobydoo754

customer_reviews.title: Good but may be slightly blurry due to lack of lens adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Fits nexus 6p, well made for the materials, its major downfall is that you cannot adjust the lenses so you'll have to change your eye balls if you want it in focus, unless your lucky enough to be in the range of the fixed lenses. Shows how great VR can be but would go for something with adjustable lenses like some of the cardboard options if I were to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Specialk

customer_reviews.title: Amazing kit, highly reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Such an amazing VR kit and possibly the best upgrade for Google Cardboard owners. Even works with Google cardboard apps which is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H

customer_reviews.title: Stick to a 4K screen'ed Android or equivalent and it should work great.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe my expectations were too high but the image quality when using an iPhone 6S is awful. Very pixellated. Stick to a 4K screen'ed Android or equivalent and it should work great.
customer_reviews.author: Squuiid

customer_reviews.title: Apps won't download
customer_reviews.text: Head set works great, I love it. Just what I wanted instead of a cut-out piece of cardboard for my kids, however. The apps are currently not installing, so the demo disc you get with it is useless. And the other games that you can buy are now worthless. Unless they update soon to fix this bug all this is is just a plastic version of google cardboard. Which I was happy to buy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Cannot get it to work 😒 Which is a shame as it looks amazing.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: For nostalgia freaks who remember the original, there are better VR headsets out there with free or a lot cheaper software.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pow

customer_reviews.title: Fails to meet my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as I thought it would be as clicking on certain images does not do anything. I am not sure if the device is faulty or it is designed that way. Fails to meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Annoyed it was a German version.
customer_reviews.text: It was good fun but not one bit of English on the box or instructions. Not a great start having to scour the Internet for English instructions. If I buy something off Amazon UK I do expect it to be in Englush unless stated.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Good present for long-distance family
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom, who lives across the country from me. I take pictures of my life through the app and send it to her over text/email, and she can look at the pictures in the View-Master and show them to my grandma as well. My favorite feature is the sound recording. I can talk to my mom while I'm taking the picture, like audible captions.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: The apps and disk that are included in the starter pack (or at least the one we purchased in Dec. 2019) have been discontinued so the product was absolutely worthless. They were discontinued in Nov. of 2019 so even when I purchased this product it would not have worked. I'm sure if you want to purchase additional disks with currently available apps then the actual physical product will work but we had already purchased additional disks that were also discontinued and are not looking to sink more money into a product. Pretty crappy move by Mattel in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Minozzi

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with the wildlife, underwater, and space pack. The graphics for these three packs is certainly lacking... but it's for kids and their imagination will take care of the rest! Younger kids than recommended can enjoy but the learning and educational sections will be hard to navigate by those of a younger age. Nonetheless whether your kids will be learning or just want coloring the environments they will certainly enjoy the experience. Fully immersive so it's everywhere you look there is something to see. Well worth it! Just don't expect 4K mind blowing fun as an adult with these
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Nauseous
customer_reviews.text: As an adult, this definitely makes me nauseous after a couple of minutes. You put your phone inside and then look through. Therefore, there are actually a lot of apps and options for use. You don't have to just use the discs that are made for it. My son thinks it's cool for a day, then will put it away and not use it for months. I think I bought it for about $30 and it's worth it for the entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: If you want a sense of where the future is, try these. I can see lots of sites becoming compliant with Augmented Reality, since it gives a much better user experience than a flat page. Real Estate tours, Travel destinations, Games, etc will be great with AR. Surprisingly cheap and compatible with all Google Cardboard apps I've tried. Uses my iPhone 6s Plus just fine. Resolution depends on your iPhone and the source, but can be really impressive. The only complaint is that it doesn't accommodate my glasses very well, so I had to put in my contacts to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Mudlumps

customer_reviews.title: Like amazing glasses that don't show you the real world. The real world can hurt.
customer_reviews.text: Google Cardboard done in the style of the classic view master. The little disc that comes with it needs to be thrown away, it is crappy pay to use garbage. The google play store has plenty of killer VR apps, and the cardboard app is all you need to get started. I use a nexus 6 and it just barely fits. It is a tiny bit uncentered maybe 1/32 of an inch and can't be noticed in the viewer. My work iPhone 5s fits with the little adapter bar that comes with the viewer. I wish it had a head strap so I could walk around with a viewer on my face. Then everyone would know Im cool.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great, won Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a random small gift for my husband on Christmas. We weren't "doing gifts" but wanted the kids to see us open stuff. Well...this random inexpensive gift "won" Christmas. Kids absolutely loved it. Really a simple concept. Use your phone and download apps. Seriously kids fight over this still (20 mo., almost 4yo and almost 7yo). Husband loved the novelty. (He would have preferred the new PS4 VR; Dream on babe.) so I am overall happy with this no matter how simple. Would recommend. Phone got a little warm and burns thru battery fast but not an all day activity anyways.
customer_reviews.author: K C

customer_reviews.title: and had so much fun I got my cousin one for his birthday
customer_reviews.text: I got this for myself, and had so much fun I got my cousin one for his birthday. We both grew up with the original ones as kids, so the fact that this was from View-Master really made it more fun. I have seen other versions of this, but for me the colors and the look of this is really what sold me on it. There are tons of great games and things that you can download to use with this. If you download "cardboard" you can even watch videos and such. I really like the apps where you can ride a roller coaster!
customer_reviews.author: discopanda89

customer_reviews.title: Neat starter pack but accessories are pricey
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool concept but I think it still needs a little bit of work in order to be as impressive in-person as it sounds on paper. Usability wasn't an issue and it was fairly easy to set up, following the instructions. This is definitely not the View-Master I had as a kid that was basically just a glorified slideshow. While this is a cool starter pack, the downside is that additional accessories and "extras" are quite expensive. All in all, this is a neat, interactive toy but I'm not sure how long it will keep a child entertained without having to purchase all of the pricey extras.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay D.

customer_reviews.title: It's cool, definitely not a high level VR headseat, but it's also not priced to be.
customer_reviews.text: I PAID FULL PRICE FOR THIS. It's cool, definitely not a high level VR headseat, but it's also not priced to be. It's an intro to VR for kids, but even for adults, it's pretty cool to bounce over to Greece and check out the sights for around $20. You can download a few other scenarios, so it's cool. But not something that keeps your attention for too long. Then again, if it does, I guess you upgrade to a prime time VR headset. Overall we like it!
customer_reviews.author: JWiz

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to the cardboard
customer_reviews.text: If you like a cheap way to play with the VR, but hate the 'aesthetics' of the ugly google cardboard - get this. It works with all VR apps. I wish though that the ViewMaster had their own apps developed better. They look promising but the quality just sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Sic

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner vr Headset If You Don't Wear Glasses
customer_reviews.text: I really like this Viewmaster for VR. It works pretty well with most Google Cardboard applications. The button seems to work fine on both my iPhone and Samsung Galaxy. It snaps in pretty easily and feels very secure once it's in there. The device itself is very well-built. I've had a few cheaper headsets in the past and the build quality of this is way higher. It feels like a very well-made device. My only only complaint is that it doesn't seem to fit at all with glasses. I've had a few people try it out and that was the biggest issue.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: View Master all grown up
customer_reviews.text: This is the first VR headset I have ever used, but I did my homework, and thought it was a pretty good price. I think the viewer itself works wonderfully with every app I have downloaded, but there are 2 downsides. One is that the phone can get hot within the confines of the viewer. Also, the wheels that you can buy to add to the experience are not worth the time or money. The apps I got online gave me a better virtual experience than the wheels did. You don't have to have them to use this. If you have never had a vr headset this is a great place to start.
customer_reviews.author: Caribee

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE!! Obsolete - doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Never even got to use this!! It’s obsolete and doesn’t work. It requires apps that no longer exist, and adaptable iPhone versions are only 5&6. Super irritated and going to try and return it and the multiple discs I ordered to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Veritas M

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this. I couldn't get the apps to work on 3 different phone (galaxy S7 edge, galaxy S6 and LG V10). Could not get the viewer to read the reels which I purchased separately and it is so frustrating. Finally after messing with it for over 30 minutes I was able to use the Space reel which is nice for the kids. Still can't get the wildlife to work I ended up purchasing the Samsung Gear VR and I'm happy with it. The idea behind View Master trying to keep the traditional look with the reel was good but they failed to make sure it works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A. Pineda

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable toy
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a product that my 7 year old is enjoying and a few adults that I know as well. Brings out the kids in us. The drawback for me is that I have used other android phones (Blu and Samsung J5 Prime) and they freeze. Used with an LG G3 and hey, presto! Buyer beware, the prescribed list of phones will work best. If anyone finds another phone (other than the list) that works, please share.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price, kids love it
customer_reviews.text: This is the neatest toy we have had in quite a while. It's like being right there! We have all of the discs but my grandson likes the wildlife one best. It truly is a great value for the money. The only drawback is if your child does not have their own cell phone and has to use yours. The cell phone needs to be inserted into the view master to work so if you get a call you can't answer it. I would recommend that if you buy this for your child, go to a phone store and purchase a used phone with no contract. Problem solved that easy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: cant recommend
customer_reviews.text: i must say i was a bit disappointed with this product, while it worked ok ,many times i was not getting one picture but two and had to look through one lens to enjoy the VR, the app that came with it was also very disappointing, i ended up using google cardboard and enjoyed their apps more and it worked, i almost lost my phone using it with my iphone 5S with a case, i wasn't informed that using it with a case would be a problem, i honestly cant recommend it based on my experience
customer_reviews.author: Antfitgodd

customer_reviews.title: DISCONTINUED Apps
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 4 years ago and it was decent at the time, but I pulled it back out recently and tried to use it only to find that Viewmaster has DISCONTINUED the apps for it. If you purchased the packs they sell for it, you’re SOL as they’re now useless doorstops. You can use it with Google Cardboard which makes it a very basic VR Headset. There are probably better options for the same or less.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful headset for Google Cardboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful headset for Google Cardboard, especially for beginners at its low (ish) price. It's comfortable, isn't a complete eyesore, and has a strap which is nice. What I liked: -It's very easy to put my phone in and take it out -Comfortable What I didn't like: -I really, really wish this headset had a full head strap. I suppose I get the reasoning behind it, but it's very difficult to "experience" cardboard without a full strap. -There's no way to plug in headphones, the only way to have sound is to blast it through the speakers (not good) or use Bluetooth headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product with almost no faults
customer_reviews.text: It's Google Cardboard, but less cardboardy! It performs well, but the lack of a headstrap takes away a lot from the immersive experience unless you have a deep nostalgia for holding a Viewmaster up to your face with both hands, in which case this is your lucky day. Well worth the price for kids of all ages (I'm 49!).
customer_reviews.author: Don Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Wow.  Not your 80's view-master.
customer_reviews.text: SO FREAKIN' COOL!!! As a $20 entry into the world of virtual reality, this thing is truly amazing. I got interested in Google cardboard after reading about a surgeon who created a VR sim for himself for a novel and complex surgery he was planning. You can build these on your own and there are other kits available, but this is ready to play with right away. So, I downloaded some random apps and within a couple minutes had my mom riding virtual roller coasters and visiting the alps, my husband exploring fantasy-esque caves, and me playing a point-click haunted house adventure. I'm sure it's no oculus rift, but WOW.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but I'd recommend spending more money on something more worthwhile.
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty underwhelmed by this product. I have a Note 4 and sure, it works fine with it, but it's just not real VR. The biggest complaint I have is that there is no head strap and the part that sits on your nose hurts the bridge of your nose after just a few minutes. The point of VR is to be immersed in the world. Well, you can't if you are forced to hold up the phone/VR tool the whole time. Your arm gets tired. Good price, and works for what it is, but it's not meant for more than just a brief look around.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware but bad software
customer_reviews.text: Good build quality on the goggles but the downloadable software and AR disc are pretty terrible. Seems like a lot of wasted potential here. Will work better as a standard google cardboard viewer than for the view master software. If the case won't unlatch, try squeezing the sides together while unlatching. It's a bit awkward but you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Brent J

customer_reviews.title: Great VR Headset for your Android/iOS device, with 1 flaw
customer_reviews.text: Pros: + Premium "Google Cardboard" experience headset. I've used it with my LG G-Flex 2 phone at it works incredibly well, despite my curved screen. + Comfy rubber wrapping around your head and nose which just feels right on your head. + Can fit even 5.7" phones but with the exception you probably need to remove your protective phone case to use. Cons: - No strap to hold on your head for head-only experiences. Some other Google Cardboard headsets have them. A simple DIY may work to attach your own strap, but it still sucks it doesn't have it out-of-box
customer_reviews.author: Sana

customer_reviews.title: Not functional with iPhone 5 or 6. Poor craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't not work. I tried multiple phones and the button inside to activate the phone is too soft for its job. Another product I can't return anymore. I was so excited to see this as it was a childhood toy and for them to revamp it for virtual reality was a treat. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jerseygirl218

customer_reviews.title: Not like the ViewMaster I used to have
customer_reviews.text: The virtual reality works OK (the lenses are not high precision optics) but this viewer is not designed to fit over eyeglasses. I managed to find an old pair of glasses that could just barely squeeze inside the opening. I doubt everyone will be able to do that. The VR app makes my Moto X get very warm. I'm pretty sure it just means the phone is underpowered for the amount of processing it needs to do.
customer_reviews.author: Marte

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit face well
customer_reviews.text: This headset works fine, but my biggest complaint is that it doesn't fit my face very well. The contour of the plastic is not properly designed to accommodate the bridge of my nose, so it sort of "see-saws" from left to right with my nose as the pivot. The overall experience is as good as you would expect: I see the screen images well with no borders, but sound isn't great because it is just the phone speakers from inside the headset. Also, I would have liked to have head straps. Arms get tired after a few minutes. It's not a completely immersive experience, but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Get My VR
customer_reviews.text: Got this instead of Google Cardboard and was easy to get started watching VR apps right away. Seems to be built well, phone fits in easy, nice weight, cool concept. If you are just starting out with VR, buy this, you will not regret it, or you can get a cardboard version and watch it disintegrate with each use.
customer_reviews.author: C.Bean

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. Period. IF the kids can get it out MY hands, they have a great time with it. I foresee this as being an amazing tool for learning, and the potential for future VR programs for this is limited only by imagination. There are many (and this is key for your search): "Stereoscopic" video, games, etc., available on YouTube. Some are still very basic, but others are wonderful. Buy this. Now. For the record, I am an RN, and a Musician, and have no affiliation with Amazon, or Mattel.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Templeton

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Present!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVED this for Christmas! The only two issues that I had was the instructions for AFTER you got the phone inside them and got started. It really didn't go into detail after pulling the lever while viewing the wheel. However it wasn't too hard to figure out after playing with it for awhile. Might be because this was just the starter pack. Also the file sizes of the downloads for your phone are insane. Takes awhile to download. Other than that this was great and we ALL enjoyed it!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: If you're not expecting an Occulus Rift experience, you'll totally enjoy this toy (at least it's not made of cardboard)
customer_reviews.text: What a fun little device; it totally reminded me of the viewfinder I had as a child; but wow, talk about technological advances! I have an Iphone 6 plus that fit just fine into this thing; it really gives you a taste of virtual reality. Play games; get immersed in simulations and shows. While this may not be the ultimate VR device out there, I'm giving it 5 stars because of the quality compared to it's price point. Don't expect the world; just expect to have a little fun! (Be sure to download the app VRSE by the NYtimes; great way to get acclimated).
customer_reviews.author: D.W.

customer_reviews.title: Great with Nexus 6P
customer_reviews.text: This is the best experience I've had with Google Cardboard. My Nexus 6p fits in it perfectly and the picture is crystal-clear, unlike the out-of-focus view I get with the official Cardboard 2.0. The button works great too since it's not a magnet - it actually presses your screen. As far as down sides go, the included software is sub-par when compared to other experiences. Overall, if you're looking to take a small step up from google cardboard, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: KJ7409

customer_reviews.title: I'd like to give more stars
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to give more stars, because even with my large phone, it works fairly well, but... There is absolutely no way to feed a headphone cord out of this thing... What are they thinking? Headphones are key to most vr experiences! Huge bonehead design flaw. I realize not all phones have the same jack site, but that means multiple access points, not zero. Dumb.
customer_reviews.author: your mother

customer_reviews.title: Great introduction to VR for anyone!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe how quickly my toddler picked this up and started using it. He loves looking at animals in the apps. This thing is really only as limited as the apps that you install on your phone. I use an iPhone 6 in it and it fits just fine without a case on.
customer_reviews.author: SkIan

customer_reviews.title: Great starter VR headset.
customer_reviews.text: Great headset to try out VR. You can use all the cardboard apps available on Google Play, as well as many of the VR-enabled YouTube videos. My kids love to use it and experience full immersion in another world. My only wish is there would be a head strap. You have to hold it. Anyway, giving 5 stars for the value at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed plastic VR device.
customer_reviews.text: There's a newer model that might be nicer, but this is a very nice Google Cardboard experience; possibly one of the best! Get Mobile VR station and watch 360 videos and things through YouTube with a multitude of viewing options.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Whale Jr

customer_reviews.title: love the Viewer
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use and if you have small kids they will love it! My son is a visual learner and he love to visit the places this Viewer will take you! It does require an app download for every different set you buy! Apps are free! O think Mattel did a great job! You just have to remember its a toy! But it can be used as an educational resource or supplement!
customer_reviews.author: PACIFEK-00

customer_reviews.title: Decent gift
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my daughter for Christmas. I think she really enjoyed it. We have a mobile phone that we keep at home as a house phone, and often find it pulled into the View-Master for 3D pictures to be viewed. The disc that comes with it, allows you to view Virtual Reality images. It is ok, I have seen better. But she really loves using it for looking at the 3d images instead. It might be a little expensive for everything that it does, but my daughter was happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Crowley

customer_reviews.title: Good family fun, but could've been better
customer_reviews.text: The whole package (I got this with 3 of the experience pack) is really fun! My kids love it and I find the experience very fascinating. I would love it if the company did like country-specific ones. Or like, attraction specific ones (e.g. The Grand canyon). The only thing that would make it go from a 4- star to a 5-star is if the things you learn from it should be read to you, because my kids are too young to read. That would've been a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my favorite toys that I have given this year! You download their app and slide your phone inside and it's like a virtual reality that you can interact with using the push of a button! Got as a gift but tried it out for myself first! I plan on buying one for my kids this year! It is so cool!! A great buy for the price , you most definitely get your money's worth!
customer_reviews.author: raymond valentine

customer_reviews.title: Not having a strap was a little more annoying than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Solidly build VR headset. The holder works well with my iPhone 5. Not having a strap was a little more annoying than I thought, and you have to turn your phone upside down to not hit the settings button. I kind of want to give it 4 stars for the lack of head strap and headphone access, but I knew it didn't have these features before I purchased it. Good purchase for less than $20.
customer_reviews.author: isaac

customer_reviews.title: really just want a refund if all it's good for is the preview disc that lasts 60 seconds ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work at all with the full underwater pack... really just want a refund if all it's good for is the preview disc that lasts 60 seconds and I can find no where to contact matel. A lot of the app reviews for this year said it worked last year but not this year. Oh but good news I bought this for Christmas so it's too late to return so I might as well throw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Kmck

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS FREAKING THING!!! Fits like it was built for my Nexus 6P. VR resolution sucks in general right now, and this will continue on a device like this until phone resolutions exceed 4K. That being said, its still amazing. Youtube is continuing to add content, and I would expect this product category to continue to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Akshun J

customer_reviews.title: Beware if you have vertigo
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between getting this and the old school version for my son. When this one dropped in price I bought it. Glad I did. So far we used the space program and you start to feel as is you really are floating in outer space. Even when you stop moving it still shifts so you have to catch up with it. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody

customer_reviews.title: but they field of view isn't very wide and doesn't really let you feel like you're "Inside" what you're watching
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on sale during a Prime deal to upgrade my Google Cardboard headsets, I was hoping a big jump in the quality of the VR experience but this is quite literally the same thing. It does feel sturdier than cardboard, obviously, but they field of view isn't very wide and doesn't really let you feel like you're "Inside" what you're watching. It is a good first VR headset if you've never used one and you're curious about it.
customer_reviews.author: Maxime Savage

customer_reviews.title: Really Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is so awesome. Even my husband the civil engineer (never impressed with anything) went insane over this. Only pitfalls 1. You must use a smart phone 2. Runs your phone down quickly 3. No place to plug in earbuds 4. A little hard to get working. However, our family of 5 highly recommends this product. So cool! Appropriate for all ages!
customer_reviews.author: Tania H.

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My kids were so disappointed that it did not work. Like some of the other problems, we also experienced a freeze help screen that just appeared and would not clear. Please do not waste your time. I am happy for all of those who had success with this but we did not.
customer_reviews.author: Joyously 9

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not easy to just plug and play
customer_reviews.text: The article is nice but a Little complicated to use, you have to install an App on your pone which is normally very heavy. Then I had an Issue with the help menú that displayed and could not be able to get if off. Once you get them to run kids loves what they are able to see
customer_reviews.author: S. S. Noguera

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea much better than cardboard
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea much better than cardboard. However the apps don't work; they just show a blank screen. Reviews on Android show this is a very common problem and I cannot find any response from Mattel. Also, the apps ask for permission to view your contacts and camera and photos... which is totally unnecessary. The viewer barely fits a Nexus 6p without a case, and would not fit with even the smallest case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Decent Cardboard viewer
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with this viewer if you wear glasses. Unfortunately it's impossible to use while wearing them. However if you have contacts or decent vision it's a nice Cardboard viewer. Much sturdier than the actual cardboard builds, this would be great for kids. The discs that come with it are overpriced and not all that engaging but it's an interesting toy. Cardboard content is still developing so eventually it will have more uses than it does currently.
customer_reviews.author: M. L.

customer_reviews.title: Works, but is very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: It works, in that it accurately holds a phone, but there's no way to strap it to your head, and it rather painfully dug into my nose, preventing using it for any real length of time. I have a rather large nose, so it might be fine for you if you don't mind the lack of a strap.
customer_reviews.author: Delecti

customer_reviews.title: More fun than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This was more fun that I expected--the kids had a lot of fun playing with it the week after Christmas. It was pretty neat but it made me motion sick so I didn't use it very long. But the kids enjoyed it and it was really funny watching them react to what they were experiencing!
customer_reviews.author: freeindeed

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy replacement of Google cardboard camera
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy replacement of google cardboard camera. I took out half star since it doesn't come with any builtin strap mechanism. Its a bit annoying to keep holding the device. Don't worry about the View-Master looking disks. They don't mean much in this context. I have been a big fan of the original film based View-Masters for last 35 years.
customer_reviews.author: Sachin Shah

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, but a bit clumsy to use
customer_reviews.text: More of a toy than something I'll use over and over. Much of the problem is the immaturity of the VR software. I was hoping to use the product as a sales tool for Google Street Map virtual tours, but it takes too long to set-up. Once working, there is definitely a wow factor, but still too touchy for dependability. The product itself is made well.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Gassman

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome! You insert your phone into the holder and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! You insert your phone into the holder and it allows you to virtually explore places all over the earth! Very much like the viewmaster from back in the day! Only thing would be to make the apps to use easier to find - *tip* search the app story for VR apps - it seems to be compatible with most that I've used - fun at parties too!
customer_reviews.author: Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: It was nice enough, but there just aren't that many cool ...
customer_reviews.text: It was nice enough, but there just aren't that many cool apps for it yet, and on mine, the button wouldn't work when you use it with Google Street View, which is like the only app worth using right now. I guess as time goes by these will get better, and this little set looks like it will be nice, but just needs a little improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Sozap

customer_reviews.title: Wish there was a built in strap.
customer_reviews.text: What a great and fun VR toy! I'm not a kid but I love playing this with my bluetooth headset and just getting immersed in the VR content that is out there. I have fashioned a little strap on this so that I can enjoy this hands free.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Howe

customer_reviews.title: Not terrible, but not great either.
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely excited to regain a piece of my childhood with this purchase, but the product is ultimately underwhelming. The product feels flimsy, you have to hold it the entire time, and the image quality/quality of the glass is seriously lacking. I mean, I know my phone has incredible graphics, but it's getting lost somewhere. For the price, I suppose it does the job, but I would have expected more nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Harris Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great product but not a lot of original content for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product but not a lot of original content for kids. The starter demo disk that comes with the starter pack doesn't scan correctly. Best just to download the apps from the app store and operate. Other issues I've found is that the iPhone and Android phones I use for this product heat up in this unit. Be aware! Do not let your young kids operate by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent gift idea for anybody who loves gadgets and technology
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent gift idea for anybody who loves gadgets and technology ,especially for boys,husbands,boyfriends,etc. Personally me, i got this for my husband and he got SO EXCITED, like a small kid with a new toy. Immediately he dowloaded some apps and after you have to put you phone inside,set up all and Voila, you got a 3D experience .Its actually quite amazing,even me i was impressed.You get images from the ocean or forest and seems so REALISTIC . Also for better experience you need to have a prone with very good resolution. Overall is a very fun toy for any age. Definetely recommend .
customer_reviews.author: dana

customer_reviews.title: super cool!
customer_reviews.text: One of my daughters friends had one of these and the kids kept saying how awesome it was. So I tried them out and yes, they are awesome! We used a few different apps for different games and experiences. I like that these are really affordable and easy to use. We have used it with a smaller iPhone 5 and my bigger iPhone 6. It's a lot of fun and at this price point it's a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Uh, buy it now.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Why aren't you buying it right now? Stop reading and buy it. It is so awesome to see where the state of technological advancement in entertainment is headed. This is one-million times better than it's competitors, which are made of cardboard. Get this thing, get some of the free apps that you can buy in the App Store. Amazing. Get the "Vrse" app. I am in no way affiliated with any app making, this product, or any other. It's just freakin' awesome.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: I love this view master
customer_reviews.text: I love this view master, I had the original one when I was a kid and this cannot compare at all. It works with my iPhone 6+ and now also with my Galaxy S7. The games were limited on the iPhone 6+ but now with the Android there are so many games, why bother getting the Gear headset when you can just use this VR kit for a fraction of the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle K

customer_reviews.title: They thought it was really cool for about 15 minutes when they were either through ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for my 2 kids, 9&11. They thought it was really cool for about 15 minutes when they were either through our the credit card had to come out. Apple fans are probably more amenable to being nickled and dimed after buying something, but I am not. Their is no strap, and no remote, so it's use beyond the paid for each reel is limited. Less than 2 weeks old, 20 minutes of use, throwing them out because they are just clutter now.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Daly

customer_reviews.title: It looks great, kind of like being in a planetarium
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could use it with the Google Cardboard app & experience 3D videos on YouTube. I played some of the mini games in Cardboard & View-Master's own minigames for the View-Master Space app which I downloaded for free from the Google Play store. It looks great, kind of like being in a planetarium. There are other free apps you can use with it as well. It works be better if it strapped to your head.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive and durable viewer
customer_reviews.text: I got these to play around with VR for classes I teach. While they don't have straps to hold the device on your head, for short term classroom use this isn't necessary. And plastic will hold up well - they're pretty sturdy. They have a QR code so you can use them w/ Google Cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L.

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work - Returned
customer_reviews.text: Returned this headset - three generations worked but could never get it to work with the Wildlife app. Catch would not stay closed but we could have used tape if it had worked. I have returned it and gotten a refund for the Wildlife App from iTunes. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: EJBH

customer_reviews.title: Not good for IPhone 6
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this but it's really not that good, especially for iPhone 6. Tried it with Cardboard and felt like it was missing more depth, sometimes the VR was good but most times it was underwhelming. I tried it with my girlfriends IPhone 6 Plus and definitely had better results as far as the VR is concerned. The size of the phones screen and it's resolution play a big role!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Pasillas

customer_reviews.title: Needs a strap for your head
customer_reviews.text: It does its job, but could really uses a strap so you don't have to hold it to your head all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Bryson Pierce

customer_reviews.title: And... I stole this from my kids!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my kids to share, and ended up using it myself to experience VR content. Now, it doesn't match exactly with every VR app I tried, but most. I am planning to return this one to my children and purchase another headset for myself, although, I'll probably go with one for adults, this is a great starter for anyone!
customer_reviews.author: RebeccaBooski

customer_reviews.title: A little bit amazing
customer_reviews.text: This was the hot item for Christmas to work directly with you smartphone. I have to say my 12 year old son finds it fascinating and it keeps him busy for long periods of time. Although it allows use of electronics, it encourages scientific and historical interests. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

product_meta.title: View-Master First Look Kit Action Game
product_meta.description: View-Master First Look Kit: View-Master works with Google Cardboard to deliver an affordable, kid-friendly immersive digital experience. The iconic View-Master toy now with a 21st century twist! View-Master First-Look offers an easy-to-use and affordable platform that will enable users to take engaging field trips where they can explore famous places, landmarks, nature, planets and more in 360 degree 'photospheres'. By pairing the View-Master's 'experience reel' and app with an Android smartphone, kids will immediately experience an imaginative and interactive learning environment.
feature_bullets: Enter the world of virtual reality with the View-Master Virtual Reality Starter Pack
This kid-friendly device will surround you with stunning 360-degree environments so you feel as if you are really there
Download one of the View-Master VR apps to your smartphone
Then slide your smartphone into the viewer, look at the Preview Reel and simply click the lever to launch yourself into 360-degree immersive experiences
The Preview Reel included with the View-Master VR Starter Pack allows you to demo available apps so you can try all Experience Packs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,261 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
